primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the universal human condition of bondage to 'Adam' (Sin/Death) by incorporating humanity into the death and resurrection of Christ to grant a 'life sentence'.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically through the 'act of righteousness' in Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father
He has brought us out of death into life
God... uses us to be his agents

object.identificatie: Acquittal, Newness of Life, and Resurrection
tekstueel_bewijs: leads to acquittal and life for all men

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Glory of the Father
tekstueel_bewijs: raised from the dead by the glory of the Father
acquittal and life for all men
all of us who have been baptized

tegenstander.identificatie: The Power of Sin (The Old Adam) and Death
tekstueel_bewijs: the old Adam in us is so strong
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as a ruling power and ontological bondage that 'we cannot do ourselves'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, having been moved from death to life, acts as an agent of God's goodness in the world (Ethics).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The 'New Creation' Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Ethical witness (e.g., mercy toward the guilty, care for the poor)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Ethics is explicitly defined as the 'foundation' or consequence of the movement from death to life.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father
He has brought us out of death into life
God... uses us to be his agents
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we too might walk in newness of life
you also must consider yourselves dead to sin

voorbeelden: you also must consider yourselves dead to sin
Western visitors come to soak up... spiritual aura
Do you not know that all of us...
only a far greater power can undo his effects

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (power) and the divine endowment of a new state of being.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Universal Condemnation) through ~S2 (The illusion of innocence/Tibet/Dentists) to S1 (The Life Sentence in Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Subject-switch' where Christ's righteousness replaces the human lack.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; sin is treated as a 'heavy load' and 'enslaving power'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains God/Christ as the primary actor in the soteriological program and treats human goodness as a derivative gift.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the Mother's testimony
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Is that Adam speaking, or is that Christ?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has brought us out of death into life.
When we do good things, that points beyond ourselves to Christ. It is not our righteousness, it is his.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Adam/Christ) are used as corporate representatives/powers rather than moral examples to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Christ is the one who acts; we are 'in' Him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'exhausting' task of maintaining idealistic illusions.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace alone through union with Christ.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (salvation) to the secondary (ethics) is perfectly maintained via the 'foundation' logic.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Rizzo is guilty' reality and the 'Life sentence' of grace.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: united with him in a death like his... in Christ shall all be made alive

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'newness of life' functions as the endowment of competence.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It avoids making the hearer the subject of their own salvation.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon effectively uses the Greimassian 'Subject-switch' to move the hearer from a place of moral striving to a place of receiving divine life.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'Tibet' or 'Dentist' anecdotes as illustrations, semiotics reveals they are actantial tests for the 'Opponent' (Sin).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 6; semiotics shows how the sermon *functions* as a narrative of liberation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'mother of the victim' is not a moral hero (Subject) but a vessel through which the primary Subject (Christ) acts.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Death Penalty' news as a semiotic foil for the 'Life Sentence' of the Gospel.
